The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocumentPickerViewController/directoryURL] property only returns a value when you explicitly set it. For example, it doesn’t calculate the default URL presented to the user when the property isn’t set.

# directoryURL

**Instance Property**

The initial directory that the document picker displays.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var directoryURL: URL? { get set }
```

## Discussion

Set this property to specify the starting directory for the document picker. This property defaults to `nil`. If you specify a value, the document picker tries to start at the specified directory. Otherwise, it starts with the last directory chosen by the user.

The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocumentPickerViewController/directoryURL] property only returns a value when you explicitly set it. For example, it doesn’t calculate the default URL presented to the user when the property isn’t set.



## Getting the user-selected document

- **delegate**: An object that acts as the delegate of the view controller.
- **UIDocumentPickerDelegate**: A set of methods for tracking when the user selects a document or destination, or cancels the operation.
- **allowsMultipleSelection**: A Boolean value that determines whether the user can select more than one document at a time.
